qas.question: What is the estimated range for the number of flowering plants?
How many species of moss is there?
What does the large number of flowering plant species indicate is true of them in general?
What are the minimum number of families in the APG system?
How many families are in AGP III?
How is moss seen more than families in the system?
What is true about families more than moss or pteridophytes?
How many flowering plants are in APG in 1998?
What are the minimum number of species of moss in the APG system?
In APG III how many species of flowering plants are there?

context: The number of species of flowering plants is estimated to be in the range of <a0_0>250,000 to 400,000<a0_0/>. This compares to around <a1_0>12,000<a1_0/> species of moss or 11,000 species of pteridophytes, showing that the flowering plants are <b5_0>much more <a2_0><b6_0>diverse<b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/>. The number of families in APG (1998) was <b7_0>462<b7_0/>. In APG II (2003) it is not settled; at maximum it is 457, but within this number there are 55 optional segregates, so that the minimum number of families in this system is <a3_0><b8_0>402<b8_0/><a3_0/>. In APG III (2009) there are <a4_0><b9_0>415<b9_0/><a4_0/> families.
